alert.note: Alert for Lafayette (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 15 at 2:44PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Lafayette and eastern Madison Counties through 330 PM EDT... At 244 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles northeast of Madison to near Dowling Park. Movement was northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Madison, Lee, Townsend, Chancey, Buckville, Hanson, Day and Mayo Junction. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
